definition: to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The morning glory climbs the trunk with its tendril .
sentences.chinese: 牽牛花用卷鬚攀着樹幹。

sentences.english: There is Our love which winds through days like morning glories.
sentences.chinese: 有我們的愛情像牽牛花天風。

sentences.english: Morning Glory clouds are a specific and more unusual type of roll clouds.
sentences.chinese: 牽牛花雲是滾軸雲中比較獨特而少見的一種。

sentences.english: I discovered the morning glory had been in bloom.
sentences.chinese: 我發現了已經開了的牽牛花。

sentences.english: Morning-glories upfold their flowers by noon.
sentences.chinese: 牽牛花在中午時就合上了。

sentences.english: Weedy morning-glory vines overran the rainforest canopy.
sentences.chinese: 蔓生的牽牛花藤越過了雨林的天蓬，瘋長開去。

definition: to be shaded or concealed by foliage/to conceal/hidden/covert/shade (of a tree)
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
